summary: This bill, the Federal Reserve Board Abolition Act, aims to abolish the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and all Federal Reserve Banks. It would repeal the Federal Reserve Act one year after the bill's enactment. The bill outlines a process for managing the dissolution, including liquidation of assets under the Office of Management and Budget and transfer of proceeds to the Treasury. The Secretary of the Treasury would assume outstanding liabilities, with a joint report to Congress detailing implementation actions required by the passage of this bill.
